    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Board
    The Board class represents the game board, including tiles, objectives, and observers.
    Board
    The Board class represents a graphical component that displays the game board, including tiles and player positions.
    CurrentPlayerView
    The CurrentPlayerView class represents a graphical component that displays the current player's information, including their name, current objective, and a button to proceed to the next turn.
    CurrentTile
    The CurrentTile class represents a graphical component that displays the current tile and provides a button to rotate it.
    GameControler
    The GameControler class manages game-related operations, such as making moves, advancing turns, and checking the game over status.
    GameState
    The GameState class manages the state of the game, including players, the board, and game-related logic such as turns, movements, and objectives.
    InterfaceSwing
    The InterfaceSwing class represents the graphical user interface for the game, implementing the ObserverBoard and ObserverGame interfaces to update the game state.
    Main
    The Main class contains the entry point for the application.
    MovementArrows
    The MovementArrows class represents a graphical component that provides arrow buttons for moving the current player in different directions.
    Objective
    The Objective class represents an objective in a game, including its name and image link.
    ObserverBoard
    The ObserverBoard interface defines a method to update the position of a range of tiles on the board.
    ObserverGame
    The ObserverGame interface defines methods to update various aspects of the game state, including player positions, scores, the current player, and the game over status.
    Player
    The Player class represents a player in a game, including their name, image, objectives, position, and score.
    ScoreBoard
    The ScoreBoard class represents a graphical component that displays the scores of players in the game.
    Side
    The Side enum represents the four possible sides of a tile.
    Tile
    The Tile class represents a tile in a game or graphical application.
    TileControler
    The TileControler class manages tile-related operations within the game, such as rotating tiles and moving ranges of tiles on the board.
    TileFactory
    The TileFactory class provides methods to create different types of Tile objects and to load images from file paths.
    TileSwing
    The TileSwing class represents a graphical tile component in the game, displaying the tile image, player pawns, and objectives.
